result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Maloney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is given 60 days (upon release from incarceration) to pay or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Maloney

defendant.name: Maloney, James E
defendant.address: 950 Dutchman Drive    Apt #11, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for James E Maloney
Current: 950 Dutchman Drive    Apt #11, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States  (Effective: 09-27-2022)
Prior: 214 7th Street North #2, Park Falls, WI 54552
DNA form from Vilas County Jail
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

8:40 AM DA calls cases: 22CM30 and 22CM52 Defendant James E Maloney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica J Prado appeared by video for James E Maloney. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached in each matter and recites the agreement on record. All parties agree to the terms  of the agreement. Defendant freely voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Court explains charges and maximum penalties for each matter. In case 22CM52  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. DE enters plea of GUILTY to each count in each matter. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC in case 22CM30 and a DEJ for 1 year in case 22CM52. 
Court imposes:

22CM30
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 
Defendant is given 60 days to pay (after release from incarceration) or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full. 

22CM52
Deferred Entry of Judgement - 1 Year 

Defendant is given 12 days sentence credit in the event that the DEJ is revoked

Appeal Rights Given
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:33 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant James E Maloney not in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica J Prado appeared by video for James E Maloney. DA Kelz states this matter has been set for a Plea and Sentencing. Court comments and states Attorney Prado has made attempts to have the defendant appear remotely however the Vilas County Jail is unable to accommodate at this date and time. DA Kelz requests Attorney Prado contact the Judicial Assistant to set a new Plea and Sentencing date.  Attorney Prado states she will be in contact with the Judicial Assistant as well as Vilas County Jail to make arrangements for a new Plea and Sentencing Date. Adjourned 1:36 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:02 AM Defendant James E Maloney appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has not recieved a copy of the complaint. Court states the complaint can be read to the defendant or recieve a copy of the complaint. DA Kelz presents the defendant with a copy of the complaint. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.   DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Bond already set and is to continue.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence

2:02 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is  04/12/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): E.V. unless a written waiver is filed with the
Clerk of Courts Office during business hours OR with the Price County Sheriffs Office outside of normal
business hours
#No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends
school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of
telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited.
The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate
circumstances.
Defendant shall not consume any alcohol
